instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.S5_PWR_EN: What is S5_PWR_EN? S5_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on all S5 power rails when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I have a board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power, consuming 0.01A
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Replaced why?
Please post all the steps you did in a repair process; including the reason of a component change...

With these voltages, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> MUST generate <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, at L7560.
If not, check all surrounded components and their traces.
Be sure to have good solders.
Also check diode mode at L7520/60.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
ok, <CAPACITOR>C3208</CAPACITOR> was shorted i found L7560 shorted into ground on diode mode. 
thanks for your help
